summary: This is an email chain from November 12, 2020, discussing media inquiries about the FBI sharing findings with Jeffrey Epstein's victims. It references an internal investigation by the Office of Professional Responsibility into the Southern District of Florida's handling of the case and mentions an alleged affair between the Criminal Division chief in SDFL and one of Epstein's attorneys.

persons.name: James Margolin
persons.context: Appears as the initial sender of an email to the group, informing them that the N.Y. Post is asking about a Mirror Online story regarding the FBI sharing findings with Epstein victims.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in the subject line of the email chain regarding the Mirror Online story about the FBI sharing findings with Epstein victims, which included information about him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the case; the document discusses the FBI sharing findings with his victims and investigations into the handling of his case.

connections.description: The email subject references the FBI sharing findings about Epstein with victims, including information about Prince Andrew, implying an association relevant to the investigation.

events.title: Media Inquiry about FBI Victim Briefings
events.description: The N.Y. Post and Mirror Online report on and inquire about the FBI and Office of Professional Responsibility meeting with Epstein victims to discuss findings related to the Southern District of Florida's dealings with victims.

events.title: OPR Investigation into SDFL's Epstein Case Handling
events.description: The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) investigated the Southern District of Florida's dealings with victims, focusing on the Crime Victims' Rights Act and the negotiation of the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).

events.title: Alleged Affair Between SDFL Crim Chief and Epstein Attorney
events.description: ABC News learned that the Criminal Division chief in the Southern District of Florida was allegedly having an affair with one of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys.

keyFacts: The FBI and the Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) were meeting with Jeffrey Epstein's victims to discuss OPR's findings regarding the Southern District of Florida's conduct.
The investigation focused on potential violations of the Crime Victims' Rights Act and the manner in which Epstein's 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) was negotiated.
ABC News reported an allegation that the Criminal Division chief in the Southern District of Florida was having an affair with one of Epstein's attorneys.
The email chain shows internal DOJ coordination and media monitoring in response to a Mirror Online story about the FBI sharing findings, including information about Prince Andrew, with victims.
